Name: Amos, Harold
Inventions / accomplishments: First African-American department chair at Harvard Medical School

Name: Alcorn, George Edward, Jr.
Inventions / accomplishments: Invented a method of fabricating an imaging X-ray spectrometer

Name: Andrews, James J.
Inventions / accomplishments: Put forth the Andrews–Curtis conjecture in group theory with Morton L. Curtis, still unsolved

Name: Alexander, Archie
Inventions / accomplishments: Responsible for the construction of many roads and bridges, including the Whitehurst Freeway, the Tidal Basin Bridge, and an extension to the Baltimore-Washington Parkway.

Name: Bailey, Leonard C.
Inventions / accomplishments: Folding bed (debatable - another source says it was Sarah Goode in 1885.)

Name: Ball, Alice Augusta
Inventions / accomplishments: Extracted chaulmoogra oil for the treatment of Hansen's disease (leprosy)

Name: Banneker, Benjamin
Inventions / accomplishments: Constructed wooden clock; astronomer; assisted in the survey of the original boundaries of the District of Columbia; authored a series of almanacs and ephemerides; naturalist: recorded observations on emergences of periodical cicadas and on the behavior of honey bees.

Name: Banyaga, Augustin
Inventions / accomplishments: Work on diffeomorphisms and symplectomorphisms

Name: Bashen, Janet
Inventions / accomplishments: First African-American woman to receive a patent for a web-based software invention, LinkLine, an Equal Employment Opportunity case management and tracking software

Name: Bath, Patricia
Inventions / accomplishments: First African-American female physician to receive a patent for a medical invention; inventions relate to cataract surgery and include the Laserphaco Probe, which revolutionized the industry in the 1980s, and an ultrasound technique for treatment

Name: Beard, Andrew
Occupation(s): Farmer, carpenter, blacksmith, railroad worker, businessman, inventor
Inventions / accomplishments: Janney coupler improvements; invented the car device #594,059 dated November 23, 1897; rotary engine patent #478,271 dated July 5, 1892

Name: Bell, Earl S.
Inventions / accomplishments: Invented chair with sliding skin (2004) and the quantitative display apparatus (2005)

Name: Benjamin, Miriam
Inventions / accomplishments: Invented "Gong and Signal Chair for Hotels"; second African-American woman to receive a patent

Name: Berry, Leonidas
Inventions / accomplishments: Gastroscope pioneer

Name: Bharucha-Reid, Albert T.
Inventions / accomplishments: Probability theory and Markov chain theorist

Name: Black, Keith
Inventions / accomplishments: Brain tumor surgery and research

Name: Blackwell, David
Inventions / accomplishments: First proposed the Blackwell channel model used in coding theory and information theory; one of the eponyms of the Rao–Blackwell theorem, which is a process that significantly improves crude statistical estimators

Name: Blair, Henry
Inventions / accomplishments: Second black inventor to issue a patent; invented seed planter and cotton planter.

Name: Boahen, Kwabena
Inventions / accomplishments: Silicon retina able to process images in the same manner as a living retina

Name: Boone, Sarah
Inventions / accomplishments: Ironing board allowing sleeves of women's garments to be ironed more easily

Name: Bouchet, Edward
Inventions / accomplishments: First African-American to receive a PhD in any subject; received physics doctorate from Yale University in 1876

Name: Bowman, James
Inventions / accomplishments: Pathologist and geneticist; Professor Emeritus Pritzker School of Medicine; first tenured African-American professor at the University of Chicago Division of Biological Sciences

Name: Boykin, Otis
Inventions / accomplishments: Artificial heart pacemaker control unit

Name: Brady, St. Elmo
Inventions / accomplishments: Published three scholarly abstracts in Science; collaborated on a paper published in the Journal of Industrial and Engineering Chemistry

Name: Branson, Herman
Inventions / accomplishments: Protein structure research

Name: Brooks, Charles
Inventions / accomplishments: Street sweeper truck and a type of paper punch

Name: Henry Brown
Inventions / accomplishments: Invented fire safe

Name: Brown, Oscar E.
Inventions / accomplishments: Received a patent for an improved horseshoe[46]

Name: Brown, Marie Van Brittan
Inventions / accomplishments: Invented the home security system

Name: Burr, John Albert
Inventions / accomplishments: Rotary-blade lawn mower patent

Name: Cannon, Thomas C.
Inventions / accomplishments: Led a group of engineers who developed the Tactical Optical Fiber Connector (TOFC), the first fiber optic connector deployed under battlefield conditions, and the ST Connector that helped make fiber optic communications affordable.

Name: Cardozo, William Warrick
Inventions / accomplishments: Sickle cell anemia studies; in October 1937 he published "Immunologic Studies in Sickle Cell Anemia" in the Archives of Internal Medicine; many of the findings are still valid today

Name: Carson, Ben
Inventions / accomplishments: Pediatric neurosurgery at Johns Hopkins University; first surgeon to successfully separate craniopagus twins

Name: Carruthers, George
Inventions / accomplishments: Invented ultraviolet camera/spectrograph, which was used by NASA when it launched Apollo 16 in 1972

Name: Carver, George Washington
Inventions / accomplishments: Discovered hundreds of uses for previously useless vegetables and fruits, principally the peanut

Name: Chappelle, Charles W.
Occupation(s): Electrician, construction, international businessman, and aviation pioneer
Inventions / accomplishments: Designed long-distance flight airplane; the only African-American to invent and display the airplane at the 1911 First Industrial Air Show held in conjunction with the Auto Show at Grand Central Palace in Manhattan in New York City; president of the African Union Company, Inc.

Name: Chappelle, Emmett
Inventions / accomplishments: Valuable contributions to several fields: medicine, biology, food science, and astrochemistry

Name: Clark, Mamie
Inventions / accomplishments: Conducted 1940s experiments using dolls to study children's attitudes about race

Name: Clark, Kenneth
Inventions / accomplishments: First Black president of the American Psychological Association

Name: Crosthwait, David, Jr.
Inventions / accomplishments: Heating, ventilation, and air conditioning; received some 40 US patents relating to HVAC systems

Name: Curtis, James H (Nick)
Inventions / accomplishments: Organic ionogen for aluminum electrolytic capacitors, cationic dialdehyde polysaccharides for wet strength paper and others, US Patent Office US Pat #3609467 US Pat #3547423 and others

Name: Dabiri, John
Inventions / accomplishments: Expert on jellyfish hydrodynamics and designer of a vertical-axis wind farm adapted from schooling fish

Name: Daly, Marie Maynard
Inventions / accomplishments: First black American woman with a PhD in chemistry

Name: Dean, Mark
Inventions / accomplishments: Led the team that developed the ISA bus, and led the design team responsible for creating the first one-gigahertz computer processor chip

Name: Drew, Charles
Inventions / accomplishments: Developed improved techniques for blood storage

Name: Du Chaillu, Paul
Inventions / accomplishments: Explorer; first modern European outsider to confirm the existence of gorillas, and later the Pygmy people of central Africa; identified as white throughout life, but his mother was a Réunionnais mulatto; settled in America and considered it his country by adoption; the full aspects of his ancestry were not uncovered until 1979, and are still little known today

Name: Easley, Annie
Inventions / accomplishments: Work at the Lewis Research Center of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration and its predecessor, the National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics

Name: Ellis, Clarence "Skip"
Inventions / accomplishments: First African American with a PhD in computer science; software inventor including OfficeTalk at Xerox PARC

Name: Ezerioha, Bisi
Inventions / accomplishments: Drag racing engineer and driver

Name: Ferguson, Lloyd Noel
Inventions / accomplishments: Chemistry doctorate, first received (1943, University of California, Berkeley)

Name: Fryer, Roland G., Jr.
Inventions / accomplishments: Inequality studies

Name: Gates, Sylvester James
Inventions / accomplishments: Work on supersymmetry, supergravity, and superstring theory

Name: Goode, Sarah E.
Inventions / accomplishments: Cabinet bed invention; first African-American woman to receive a patent in the United States

Name: Gilbert, Juan E.
Inventions / accomplishments: Awarded the first Presidential Endowed Chair at Clemson University in honor of his accomplishments

Name: Grant, George F.
Inventions / accomplishments: The first African-American professor at Harvard, Boston dentist, and inventor of a wooden golf tee.

Name: Green, Lisa
Inventions / accomplishments: Specializes in syntax and the study of African American English

Name: Griffin, Bessie Blount
Inventions / accomplishments: Amputee self-feeding device

Name: Harris, James A.
Inventions / accomplishments: Co-discovered Rutherfordium (element 104) and Dubnium (element 105) at Lawrence Livermore Laboratory

Name: Hawkins, Walter Lincoln
Inventions / accomplishments: Inventor at Bell Laboratories

Name: Holley, Kerrie
Inventions / accomplishments: IBM's 1st black Distinguished Engineer and 2nd black IBM Fellow.  Inventor of several software engineering techniques including system and methods for locating mobile devices using location and presence information

Name: Jackson, John W
Inventions / accomplishments: Co-inventor of imaging x-ray spectrometer.

Name: Jackson, Mary
Inventions / accomplishments: NASA's first black female engineer

Name: Jackson, Dr. Shirley
Inventions / accomplishments: Helped develop technologies leading to the invention of the touch-tone telephone, portable fax, solar cells, fiber optic cables, and the technology enabling caller ID and call waiting.[citation needed] However, in a recent article from MIT, there is no evidence that she helped to develop these technologies.[82]

Name: Jarvis, Erich
Inventions / accomplishments: Duke University neuroscience bird songs studies

Name: Jennings, Thomas L.
Inventions / accomplishments: First African American to be granted a patent (for a dry cleaning process called dry scouring)

Name: Johnson, Isaac
Inventions / accomplishments: Held patent for improvements to the bicycle frame, specifically so it could be taken apart for compact storage

Name: Johnson, Lonnie
Inventions / accomplishments: Invented Super Soaker while researching thermal energy transfer engines; worked with NASA; holder of over 80 patents

Name: Johnson, Katherine
Inventions / accomplishments: Made contributions to the United States' aeronautics and space programs with the early application of digital electronic computers at NASA.

Name: Jones, Frederick McKinley
Inventions / accomplishments: Invented refrigerated truck systems

Name: Julian, Percy
Inventions / accomplishments: First to synthesize the natural product physostigmine; earned 130 chemical patents; lauded for humanitarian achievements

Name: Just, Ernest
Occupation(s): Woods Hole Marine Biology Institute biologist
Inventions / accomplishments: Provided basic and initial descriptions of the structure–function–property relationship of the plasma membrane of biological cells

Name: Kittles, Rick
Inventions / accomplishments: Work in tracing the ancestry of African Americans via DNA testing

Name: Kountz, Samuel L.
Inventions / accomplishments: Organ transplantation pioneer, particularly renal transplant research and surgery; author or co-author of 172 articles in scientific publications

Name: Latimer, Lewis
Inventions / accomplishments: Worked as a draftsman for both Alexander Graham Bell and Thomas Edison; became a member of Edison's Pioneers and served as an expert witness in many light bulb litigation lawsuits; said to have invented the water closet

Name: Lawson, Jerry
Inventions / accomplishments: Designer of Fairchild Channel F, the first programmable ROM cartridge-based video game console

Name: Lee, Raphael Carl
Inventions / accomplishments: Paul and Aileen Russell Professor, Pritzker School of Medicine; MacArthur Fellow, Searle Scholar, founder and chairman, Avocet Polymer Technologies, Inc.; founder and chairman, Renacyte BioMolecular Technologies, Inc; discovered use of surfactant copolymers as molecular chaperones to augment endogenous injury repair mechanisms of living cells; holder of many patents covering scar treatment therapies, tissue engineered ligaments, brain trauma therapies, and protective garments[citation needed]

Name: Lynk, Beebe Steven
Inventions / accomplishments: Teacher at West Tennessee University

Name: Mahoney, Mary
Inventions / accomplishments: First African American to study and work as a professionally trained nurse in the United States[112]

Name: Matzeliger, Jan
Inventions / accomplishments: Shoe assembly Machine

Name: McBay, Henry
Inventions / accomplishments: His discoveries allowed chemists around the world to create inexpensive peroxide compounds

Name: McCoy, Elijah
Inventions / accomplishments: Invented a version of the automatic lubricator for steam engines, McCoy learned a great deal of his skills from a mechanical apprenticeship when he was age fifteen  .

Name: McWhorter, John
Inventions / accomplishments: Specializes in the study of creole language formation

Name: Montgomery, Benjamin
Inventions / accomplishments: Designed a steam operated propeller to provide propulsion to boats in shallow water

Name: Moore, Willie Hobbs
Inventions / accomplishments: First African American woman to earn a PhD in Physics (University of Michigan Ann Arbor 1972) on vibrational analysis of secondary chlorides

Name: Morgan, Garrett
Inventions / accomplishments: Invented an early version of a gas mask called a smoke hood, and created the first traffic light that included a third "warning" position which is standard today. Morgan also developed a chemical that was used in hair products for hair-straightening.

Name: Miles, Alexander
Inventions / accomplishments: Invented electric elevator doors that automatically open and close

Name: Nriagu, Jerome
Inventions / accomplishments: Studies toxic metals in the environment; supporter of the lead poisoning thesis of the decline of the Roman Empire

Name: Oyekan, Soni
Inventions / accomplishments: Inventions in oil refining

Name: Parker, Alice H.
Inventions / accomplishments: Furnace for Central Heating

Name: Poindexter, Hildrus
Inventions / accomplishments: Work on the epidemiology of tropical diseases, including malaria

Name: Petters, Arlie
Inventions / accomplishments: Work on the mathematical physics of gravitational lensing

Name: Quarterman, Lloyd Albert
Inventions / accomplishments: Manhattan Project, worked with Albert Einstein and Enrico Fermi

Name: Rillieux, Norbert
Inventions / accomplishments: Inventor of the multiple-effect evaporator

Name: Robinson, Larry
Inventions / accomplishments: Investigated possible role of arsenic in the death of Zachary Taylor; interim president of Florida A&M University

Name: Ross, Archia
Inventions / accomplishments: A runner for stoops (1896), bag closure device (1898), a wrinkle-preventing trouser stretcher (1899), a garment-hanger (1903), and a holder for brooms and like articles.

Name: Russell, Jesse
Inventions / accomplishments: Wireless communications engineer

Name: Sammons, Walter
Inventions / accomplishments: Patent for hot comb

Name: Sowell, Thomas
Inventions / accomplishments: Economist, social theorist and political philosopher

Name: Steele, Claude
Inventions / accomplishments: Stereotype threat studies

Name: Stiff, Lee
Inventions / accomplishments: President of the National Council of Teachers of Mathematics from 2000 to 2002

Name: Snyder, Window
Inventions / accomplishments: Security engineer at Microsoft, Mozilla, and Apple

Name: Temple, Lewis
Inventions / accomplishments: Inventor of the toggling whaling harpoon head

Name: Thomas, Vivien
Inventions / accomplishments: Blue baby syndrome treatment in the 1940s

Name: Turner, Charles Henry
Inventions / accomplishments: First person to prove that insects can hear and can distinguish pitch, that cockroaches can learn by trial and error, and that honeybees can see color; first African-American to receive a PhD from the University of Chicago

Name: Tyree, G. Bernadette
Inventions / accomplishments: Program Director, Division of Musculoskeletal Diseases, at National Institute of Arthritis and Musculoskeletal and Skin Diseases, National Institutes of Health

Name: Tyson, Neil deGrasse
Inventions / accomplishments: Researcher and popular educator in astronomy and the sciences

Name: Vaughan, Dorothy
Inventions / accomplishments: Worked for NACA and NASA at Langley Research Center

Name: Valerino, Powtawche
Inventions / accomplishments: Worked for JPL and NASA at Langley Research Center

Name: Walker, Arthur B. C., Jr.
Inventions / accomplishments: Developed normal incidence multilayer XUV telescopes to photograph the solar corona

Name: Walker, C. J.
Inventions / accomplishments: Created black cosmetic products

Name: Washington, Warren M.
Inventions / accomplishments: Former chair of the National Science Board

Name: West, James E.
Inventions / accomplishments: Co-developed the foil electret microphone

Name: Wilkins, J. Ernest, Jr.
Inventions / accomplishments: Entered University of Chicago at age 13; PhD at 19; worked on the Manhattan Project; wrote over 100 scientific papers; helped recruit minorities into the sciences

Name: Williams, Daniel
Inventions / accomplishments: The first black person on record to have successfully performed pericardium (the sac surrounding the heart) surgery to repair a wound.

Name: Woods, Granville
Inventions / accomplishments: Invented the synchronous multiplex railway telegraph

Name: Wright, Jane C.
Inventions / accomplishments: Noted for her contributions to chemotherapy and for pioneering the use of the drug methotrexate to treat breast cancer and skin cancer

Name: Wright, Louis T.
Inventions / accomplishments: Led team that first used Aureomycin as a treatment on humans

Name: Young, Roger Arliner
Inventions / accomplishments: First African-American woman to receive a doctorate degree in zoology
